SEARCH
Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.auth

Class DKIMMessageParser

java.lang.Object
org.bluezoo.gumdrop.mime.MIMEParser
org.bluezoo.gumdrop.mime.rfc5322.MessageParser
org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.auth.DKIMMessageParser
public class DKIMMessageParser extends MessageParser
A message parser that captures raw header bytes for DKIM verification.

This parser extends MessageParser and intercepts header lines to capture their raw bytes before decoding. DKIM signature verification requires the original, unmodified header bytes for canonicalization.

Headers are captured in order of appearance. The parser tracks multiple occurrences of headers with the same name (e.g., multiple Received headers), which is important because DKIM signs headers in a specific order.

Captured Headers

All headers are captured, but DKIM typically signs:

  • From (required)
  • To, Cc, Reply-To
  • Subject
  • Date
  • Message-ID
  • Content-Type, MIME-Version
  • DKIM-Signature (itself, with b= removed)

The actual signed headers are determined by the h= tag in the DKIM-Signature header.

Usage


 DKIMMessageParser parser = new DKIMMessageParser();
 parser.setMessageHandler(handler);

 // Feed message data
 parser.receive(buffer);

 // After headers are complete, get raw header bytes
 byte[] fromBytes = parser.getHeaderBytes("from");
 List<byte[]> allReceivedHeaders = parser.getAllHeaderBytes("received");
Author:
Chris Burdess

  • Method Details

    • headerLine

      protected void headerLine(ByteBuffer buffer) throws MIMEParseException
      Intercepts header lines to capture raw bytes.

      This method captures the raw bytes before calling the parent implementation. Folded headers (continuation lines) are accumulated together with their preceding header line.

      Overrides:
      headerLine in class MIMEParser
      Throws:
      MIMEParseException

    • getRawHeaders

      public List<DKIMMessageParser.RawHeader> getRawHeaders()
      Returns all captured headers in order of appearance.
      Returns:
      list of raw headers

    • getRawHeader

      public DKIMMessageParser.RawHeader getRawHeader(String name)
      Returns the first raw header with the given name (case-insensitive).
      Parameters:
      name - the header name
      Returns:
      the raw header, or null if not found

    • getHeaderBytes

      public byte[] getHeaderBytes(String name)
      Returns the raw bytes of the first header with the given name.
      Parameters:
      name - the header name (case-insensitive)
      Returns:
      the raw bytes, or null if not found

    • getAllRawHeaders

      public List<DKIMMessageParser.RawHeader> getAllRawHeaders(String name)
      Returns all raw headers with the given name (case-insensitive). Headers are returned in order of appearance (first to last).
      Parameters:
      name - the header name
      Returns:
      list of raw headers (may be empty)

    • getAllHeaderBytes

      public List<byte[]> getAllHeaderBytes(String name)
      Returns the raw bytes of all headers with the given name.
      Parameters:
      name - the header name (case-insensitive)
      Returns:
      list of raw byte arrays

    • isHeadersComplete

      public boolean isHeadersComplete()
      Returns whether headers have been completely processed.
      Returns:
      true if the empty line terminating headers has been seen

      Description copied from class: MIMEParser
      Resets the parser in preparation for parsing another entity.
      Overrides:

    • initBodyHash

      public void initBodyHash(String algorithm, boolean relaxed, long lengthLimit) throws NoSuchAlgorithmException
      Initializes body hash computation.

      Call this after headers are complete and the DKIM-Signature has been parsed. The algorithm and canonicalization are determined from the signature.

      Parameters:
      algorithm - the hash algorithm ("SHA-256" or "SHA-1")
      relaxed - true for relaxed body canonicalization
      lengthLimit - body length limit from l= tag, or -1 for no limit
      Throws:
      NoSuchAlgorithmException - if algorithm not supported

    • getBodyHash

      public byte[] getBodyHash()
      Returns the computed body hash.

      Call this after parsing is complete. Trailing empty lines in the sink are intentionally not included in the hash (per RFC 6376).

      Returns:
      the body hash bytes, or null if not initialized

    • bodyLine

      protected void bodyLine(ByteBuffer buffer) throws MIMEParseException
      Intercepts body lines to compute the DKIM body hash.

      Uses a sink to defer hashing of potential trailing empty lines. Lines with content cause the sink to be flushed to the digest first.

      If body hash hasn't been initialized yet, auto-initializes it from the DKIM-Signature header (if present).

      Overrides:
      bodyLine in class MIMEParser
      Throws:
      MIMEParseException
